noun.description: A group of people assembled for religious worship.
A gathering or collection of people, animals, or things.
examples: large congregations of birds may cause public harm

noun.description: (in the Roman Catholic Church) a permanent committee of the College of Cardinals.
examples: the Congregation for the Doctrine of the Faith

noun.description: A group of people obeying a common religious rule but under less solemn vows than members of the older religious orders.
examples: the sisters of the Congregation of Our Lady

origin: Late Middle English (in congregation (sense 2, congregation sense 3, congregation sense 4)): from Latin congregatio(n-), from congregare collect (into a flock) (see congregate).
